title: Exclusive Stream: Toyger – Karl’s Diary
content:
North East music has seen some notable successes in the past 12 months, with Let’s Buy Happiness receiving critical praise from national press and Polarsets releasing a single through ultra-cool Parisian label Kitsune.

However behind this buoyant wave of bands comes a new generation of artists benefiting from the increased attention and creative input that surrounds gigs and recording studios both sides of the Tyne.

It feels like a long time ago I first posted about Toyger, and made a crude reference to their stuffed toy counterparts, however they are a fine example of one of the bands to follow in the wake of North East’s latest crop of fine musicians. They are due to release their latest single ‘Karl’s Diary‘ on the 24th October, and the track, along with their B-side ‘Purple Voices‘, mark a significant development in the band’s sound, while retaining the core characteristics that first distinguished them.

Karl’s Diary by bencrackintheroad
